newsitem.title: CHINA: HP to invest $30-50 mln in China in 1997.
newsitem.headline: HP to invest $30-50 mln in China in 1997.

text.p: U.S. computer maker Hewlett-Packard Co has pledged to invest $30-50 million in China in 1997 in a bid to increase its domestic market share, the China Daily said on Thursday.
The newspaper did not say where Hewlett-Packard would focus its investment.

But it quoted Terry Cheng, president of China HP Corp Ltd, as saying that the computer firm was aiming at a 50 percent rise in sales for the year after at least 40 percent annual growth in recent years.
"The computer market has been very hot in China, and we believe that the trend will carry on at least within this century," Cheng said.
The company's business turnover in China totalled $550 million during its 1996 budget year, of which 70 percent came from computer sales, he said.
Rapid development of China's telecommunications industry in the years ahead offered another solid opportunity, Cheng said.
A total of 1.4 million computers were sold in China this year compared with 1.1 million in 1995, the newspaper said. It gave no further details.
